## R Markdown
```{r}
library(lme4)
pr_data <- read.csv('combine_data.csv', header = TRUE)
summary(pr_data)
```

```{r}
########### dependent variable: ############
# pr_notice_time  pr_review_time pr_review_commits pr_review_comments
############ independent variable ###########

# pr_author_race + pr_changed_files + pr_LOC + pr_commits 
# (1|repo_stars) + (1|repo_create_time) + (1|repo_external_contribution) + (1|repo_team_size)

# user_followers + user_dev_time + user_experience + user_repo_experience
# user_main_member + user_watched + user_succ_rate
glmm1 <- lmer(pr_notice_time ~ pr_author_race + pr_changed_files + pr_LOC + pr_commits + repo_stars + repo_create_time + repo_external_contribution + repo_team_size + (1|user_followers) + user_dev_time + user_experience + user_repo_experience + user_main_member + user_watched + user_succ_rate, data = pr_data)

summary(glmm1, corr=F)
```
